oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Report on the North American Symposium on Bovine Respiratory Disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cummins, Joseph M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine respiratory disease
viruses
immunosuppression
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Most acute respiratory disease in humans is caused by viruses, and, similarly in cattle, viruses are blamed for the majority of cases of acute bovine respiratory disease (BRD). Viruses as etiologic agents in bovine respiratory sisease are discussed. All recognize the "Big 3", IBR, BYD, and Pl-3 as being ubiquitous bovine viruses. There are several types of evidence commonly cited to suggest that respiratory viruses are immunosuppressive.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1983; 122-126
